TopicTitle: Alert when on-rails vessel is destroyed

Articles.Content:
So I find myself, not for the first time, digging through backup files to restore a probe that I last left safely landed - and which had mysteriously vanished when I looked for it a few flights later. Fortunately, I found it, put it back, and flew it away unscathed, but...

Could we get a proper warning (pause the game and pop it up) if a vessel with a probe core, or crew, or whose type is station, probe, ship, lander, rover or base, is destroyed?

In most cases the player would be able to immediately quickload the last save, and double-check that they'd put it somewhere safe. Ideally, use a prediction of doom to say "this vessel will be destroyed in 10 minutes or less [allow to be destroyed] [go to]". 

(In this specific instance, I was landed on Hale from OPM, which is a miniscule little moon where any movement at all bounces you off the surface. It seems likely that the ship was not truly landed, but was in fact a few cm above the ground when I left it, and thus got destroyed minutes later, possibly at the moment I left the flight scene. If given an alert, I could have gone straight to F9, probably had it happen again, and finally worked out I needed to park in orbit.)

Edited September 2, 2016 by eddiew

Don't you mean an alert when a vessel ON rails is destroyed?
They only vessels off rails are those you are currently controlling or within your physics bubble. If you fail to notice your active craft explodes that's probably the least of your problems.

But I agree with your suggestion. I too mysteriously lost craft but trough different means. A returning mission got an unplanned gravity slingshot from Mun that dropped the Pe below Kerbins surface. By the time I realized it was missing it was long gone.

Could this be a landing strut problem?
